result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Pavel Jakl

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Pavel Jakl in court.  Attorney Joshua Ryan-Polczinski in court for Pavel Jakl.  Attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for State of Wisconsin. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Warrant quashed, bond reinstated, bail forfeiture hearing canceled. Not guilty plea entered by counsel. Speedy trial rights reserved. Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Notice of Bail/Bond Forfeiture and Hearing. Bond set 7-05-2022.

Defendant Pavel Jakl not in court.  Attorney Joshua Ryan-Polczinski in court for Pavel Jakl.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Attorney lost contact with client. Warrant to issue, bond forfeited. Minutes filed.
Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Pavel Jakl in court.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not qualify for SPD. Defendant plans on retaining a private attorney. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Pavel Jakl in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by JJ Crawford. Called @ 2:14 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for initial appearance. Court goes over charges, penalties, and right to attorney. Information as to attorney provided to the defendant and court sets out for appointment of counsel. Court in recess.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
State's Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH CHAMPS BAR. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

1:31 pm case called. Defendant Pavel Jakl in court, in custody by video. Samuel Berg appeared for the State. Attorney Hagerman for bond purposes only. Defendant does not qualify for public defender. Record by State as to bond. Discussion. Court sets bond as $2500 cash. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
